member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.NumberPrefix
member.summary: "$" : Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.NumberSuffix
member.summary: "p.a" : Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. To use special characters for numberPrefix or numberSuffix, you'll need to URL Encode them. That is, suppose you wish to have numberSuffix as % (like 30%), you'll need to specify it as under: numberSuffix='%25'

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.FormatNumber
member.summary: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 if formatNumber='0 '

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.FormatNumberScale
member.summary: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 10434 would become 1.04K (with decimalPrecision set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - a M will added at the end.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: "." : This option helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.ThousandSeparator
member.summary: "," : This option helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NumberFormatPropertySet.DecimalPrecision
member.summary: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart would be rounded to.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartNumericalLimitsPropertySet.YAxisMinValue
member.summary: This attribute determines the lower limit of y-axis.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartNumericalLimitsPropertySet.XAxisMinValue
member.summary: This attribute determines the upper limit of y-axis.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnimationPropertySet.Animation
member.summary: This attribute sets whether the animation is to be played or whether the entire chart would be rendered at one go.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.Abstract.FusionChartBase.TrendLines
member.summary: Using the trendLines element (and child elements), you can define trend lines on the charts. Trend lines are the horizontal lines spanning the chart canvas that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some previous pre-determined figure.

member.summary: Define a Template for a chart. You should use a object that inherits from FusionChartsTemplate.

member.summary: Return a string of the Chart Type.

member.summary: Each category element represents a x-axis data label.

member.summary: DataSet is a list of Set Elements that determines a set of data which would appear on the graph.

member.summary: Data Source. Can be ONLY a DataTable or a member that implements IList.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.Abstract.MultiSeriesChart.IsDataSourceSorted
member.summary: Indicate that the data set in DataSource property is already sorted. Useful when you have a data already sorted in the way that you want to show. If set to false(default) LiberoAPI will sort the data before parse it. Default: false;

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FontOutCanvasPropertySet.OutCnvBaseFont
member.summary: "FontName" : This attribute sets the base font family of the chart font which lies outside the canvas i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FontOutCanvasPropertySet.OutCnvBaseFontSze
member.summary: "FontSize" : This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FontOutCanvasPropertySet.OutCnvBaseFontColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode": This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

member.summary: Chart type. String, check docs to see available charts.

member.summary: Charts data. XML, schema provided by fusioncharts.com/free

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.StartValue
member.summary: 'NumericalValue': The starting y-axis value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the startValue would 102.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.EndValue
member.summary: 'NumericalValue': The ending y-axis value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the endValue would 109. If you do not specify a value for endValue, it would automatically assume the same value as startValue.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.Color
member.summary: 'HexCode' : Color of the trend line and its associated text.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.DisplayValue
member.summary: 'StringValue' : If you want to display a string caption for the trend line by its side, you can use this attribute. Example: displayValue='Last Month High'. When you don't supply this attribute, it automatically takes the value of startValue.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.Thickness
member.summary: 'NumericalValue' : Thickness of the trend line

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.IsTrendZone
member.summary: '1/0': Whether the trend would display a line, or a zone (filled colored rectangle).

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.ShowOnTop
member.summary: '1/0': Whether the trend line/zone would be displayed over other elements of the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.TrendLineElement.Alpha
member.summary: 'NumericalValue0-100': Alpha (transparency) of the trend line

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.GenericVisibilityPropertySet.ShowNames
member.summary: This attribute can have either of the two possible values: 1,0. It sets the configuration whether the x-axis values (for the data sets) will be displayed or not. By default, this attribute assumes the value true, which means that the x-axis names will be displayed.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.GenericVisibilityPropertySet.ShowValues
member.summary: This attribute can have either of the two possible values: 1,0. It sets the configuration whether the data numerical values will be displayed along with the columns, bars, lines and the pies. By default, this attribute assumes the value true, which means that the values will be displayed.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.LineShadowPropertySet.ShowShadow
member.summary: This attribute helps you set whether the line shadow would be shown or not.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.LineShadowPropertySet.ShadowColor
member.summary: "Hex Code" : If you want to set your own shadow color, you'll need to specify that color for this attribute.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.LineShadowPropertySet.ShadowThickness
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the thickness of the shadow line (in pixels).

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.LineShadowPropertySet.ShadowAlpha
member.summary: "0-100" : This attribute sets the transparency of the shadow line.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.LineShadowPropertySet.ShadowXShift
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the x shift of the shadow line from the chart line. That is, if you want to show the shadow 3 pixel right from the actual line, set this attribute to 3. Similarly, if you want the shadow to appear on the left of the actual line, set it to -3.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.LineShadowPropertySet.ShadowYShift
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the y shift of the shadow line from the chart line. That is, if you want to show the shadow 3 pixel below the actual line, set this attribute to 3. Similarly, if you want the shadow to appear above the actual line, set it to -3.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HDivisionalLinesPropertySet.NumDivLines
member.summary: This attribute sets the number of divisional lines to be drawn.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HDivisionalLinesPropertySet.DivLineColor
member.summary: The color of grid divisional line.

member.summary: Thickness (in pixels) of the grid divisional line.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HDivisionalLinesPropertySet.DivLineAlpha
member.summary: Alpha (transparency) of the grid divisional line.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HDivisionalLinesPropertySet.ShowDivLineValue
member.summary: Option to show/hide the textual value of the divisional line.

member.summary: Option on whether to show alternate colored horizontal grid bands.

member.summary: "HexColorCode" : Color of the alternate horizontal grid bands.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HDivisionalLinesPropertySet.AlternateHGridAlpha
member.summary: "NumericalValue0-100" : Alpha (transparency) of the alternate horizontal grid bands.

member.param: Tipo do eixo, primario ou secundario

member.name: M:Libero.FusionCharts.Abstract.ICombinationChart.GetAxisTypeDictionary
member.summary: Retorna o dicionario de tipos de eixo.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas2DPropertySet.CanvasBgColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : This attribute helps you set the background color of the canvas.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas2DPropertySet.CanvasBgAlpha
member.summary: "NumericalValue(0-100)" : This attribute helps you set the alpha (transparency) of the canvas.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas2DPropertySet.CanvasBorderColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : This attribute helps you set the border color of the canvas.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas2DPropertySet.CanvasBorderThickness
member.summary: "NumericalValue(0-100)" : This attribute helps you set the border thickness (in pixels) of the canvas.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BorderPropertySet.ShowBorder
member.summary: This attribute sets whether a border would be shown around the funnel segments or not. Default value: false

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BorderPropertySet.BorderColor
member.summary: 'Hex Color': This attribute sets the color of the border, which is displayed around the funnel segments when showBorder is set as true. Default value: By default, the border color of each funnel segment is the same as their background color.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BorderPropertySet.BorderThickness
member.summary: 'Numerical Value': This attribute sets the thickness, in pixels, of the border, which is displayed around the funnel segments when showBorder is set as 1. Default value: 1

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BorderPropertySet.BorderAlpha
member.summary: 'value(0-100)': This attribute sets the alpha of the border, which is displayed around the color range when showBorder is set as 1. Default value: 100

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FontBasePropertySet.BaseFont
member.summary: "FontName" : This attribute sets the base font family of the chart font which lies on the canvas i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FontBasePropertySet.BaseFontSize
member.summary: "FontSize" : This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FontBasePropertySet.BaseFontColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartMarginsPropertySet.ChartLeftMargin
member.summary: "Numerical Value (in pixels)" : Space to be left unplotted on the left side of the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartMarginsPropertySet.ChartRightMargin
member.summary: "Numerical Value (in pixels)" : Empty space to be left on the right side of the chart

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartMarginsPropertySet.ChartTopMargin
member.summary: "Numerical Value (in pixels)" : Empty space to be left on the top of the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartMarginsPropertySet.ChartBottomMargin
member.summary: "Numerical Value (in pixels)" : Empty space to be left at the bottom of the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AxisTitlesPropertySet.XAxisName
member.summary: "String" : x-Axis text title (if the chart supports axis)

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AxisTitlesPropertySet.YAxisName
member.summary: "String" : y-Axis text title (if the chart supports axis)

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BackgroundPropertySet.BgColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. Remember that you DO NOT need to assign a "#" at the beginning of the hex color code. In fact, whenever you need to provide any hex color code in FusionCharts XML data document, you do not have to assign the # at the beginning.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BackgroundPropertySet.BgAlpha
member.summary: "NumericalValue(0-100)" : This attribute helps you set the alpha (transparency) of the graph. This is particularly useful when you need to load the chart in one of your Flash movies or when you want to set a background image (.swf) for the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BackgroundPropertySet.BgSWF
member.summary: "Path of SWF File" : This attribute helps you load an external .swf file as a background for the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.MSDataSet.ParentYAxis
member.summary: Only applied to Combination Charts. Accepted values: P for primary, S for secundary.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieShadowPropertySet.ShowShadow
member.summary: This attribute helps you set whether the pie shadow would be shown or not.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieShadowPropertySet.ShadowColor
member.summary: "Hex Code": If you want to set your own shadow color, you'll need to specify that color for this attribute.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieShadowPropertySet.ShadowAlpha
member.summary: "0-100" : This attribute sets the transparency of the shadow.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieShadowPropertySet.ShadowXShift
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the x shift of the shadow pie from the actual pie. That is, if you want to show the shadow 3 pixel right from the actual pie, set this attribute to 3. Similarly, if you want the shadow to appear on the left of the actual pie, set it to -3.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieShadowPropertySet.ShadowYShift
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the y shift of the shadow pie from the actual pie. That is, if you want to show the shadow 3 pixel below the actual pie, set this attribute to 3. Similarly, if you want the shadow to appear above the actual pie, set it to -3.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartTitlesPropertySet.Caption
member.summary: This attribute determines the caption of the chart that would appear at the top of the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ChartTitlesPropertySet.SubCaption
member.summary: Sub-caption of the chart

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas3DPropertySet.CanvasBgColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : This attribute helps you set the background color of the canvas. The background of the canvas is the one behind the columns.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas3DPropertySet.CanvasBaseColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : This attribute helps you set the color of the canvas base. The canvas abse is the on which the base of the columns are placed..

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas3DPropertySet.CanvasBaseDepth
member.summary: "Numerical Value" : This attribute helps you set the height (3D Depth) of the canvas base.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas3DPropertySet.CanvasBgDepth
member.summary: "Numerical Value" : This attribute helps you set the 3D Depth of the canvas background.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas3DPropertySet.ShowCanvasBg
member.summary: This attribute helps us set whether we need to show the canvas background.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.Canvas3DPropertySet.ShowCanvasBase
member.summary: This attribute helps us set whether we need to show the canvas base.

member.summary: Number of decimal places to which upper and lower limit values on the chart would be rounded to.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AreaPropertySet.ShowAreaBorder
member.summary: Configuration whether the border over the area would be shown or not.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AreaPropertySet.AreaBorderThickness
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : If the area border is to be shown, this attribute sets the thickness (in pixels) of the area border.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AreaPropertySet.AreaBorderColor
member.summary: "Hex Color" : If the area border is to be shown, this attribute sets the color of the area border.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AreaPropertySet.AreaBgColor
member.summary: "Hex Color" : If you want the entire area chart to be filled with one color, set that color for this attribute.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AreaPropertySet.AreaAlpha
member.summary: Transparency of the area fill.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HoverCaptionPropertySet.ShowHoverCap
member.summary: Option whether to show/hide hover caption box.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HoverCaptionPropertySet.HoverCapBgColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : Background color of the hover caption box.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HoverCaptionPropertySet.HoverCapBorderColor
member.summary: "HexColorCode" : Border color of the hover caption box.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.HoverCaptionPropertySet.HoverCapSepChar
member.summary: "Char" : The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in the hover caption box.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BarsVisibilityPropertySet.ShowLimits
member.summary: Option whether to show/hide the chart limit textboxes.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BarsVisibilityPropertySet.RotateNames
member.summary: Configuration that sets whether the category name text boxes would be rotated or not.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BarsVisibilityPropertySet.ShowBarShadow
member.summary: Whether the 2D shadow for the bars would be shown or not.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.BarsVisibilityPropertySet.ShowColumnShadow
member.summary: Whether the 2D shadow for the columns would be shown or not.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FunnelPropertySet.FillAlpha
member.summary: 'value(0-100)': This attribute helps you specify the alpha (transparency) of the funnel chart as a whole, i.e., all the funnel segments would be shown in the alpha mentioned in this attribute.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FunnelPropertySet.IsSliced
member.summary: This attribute specifies whether the the various funnel segments would be sliced, i.e., separated from each other by a distance. Default value: true

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FunnelPropertySet.SlicingDistance
member.summary: If you have set the isSliced attribute to 1 or have not defined it at all (so that it takes the value 1 by default), then this attribute specifies the distance (in pixels) by which the various funnel segments would be separated from each other by. Default value: 10

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FunnelPropertySet.FunnelBaseWidth
member.summary: This attribute sets the width of the tap, i.e., the bottom part of the funnel. Default value: If you don't define this attribute, it would be auto-calculated to the most suitable value for the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.FunnelPropertySet.FunnelBaseHeight
member.summary: This attribute sets the height of the tap of the funnel. Default value: If you don't define this attribute, it would be auto-calculated to the best value for the chart.

member.name: T:Libero.FusionCharts.MSSetElement
member.summary: Cada elemento 'Multi Series Set Element' representa uma disposição de dados no eixo Y dentro da serie 'DataSet' onde ele está contido.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PiePropertySet.PieRadius
member.summary: "Numeric Pixels": FusionCharts automatically calculates the best fit pie radius for the chart. However, if you want to enforce one of your own radius values, you can set it using this attribute.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PiePropertySet.PieSliceDepth
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the 3D height (depth) of the pies on the chart (in pixels).

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PiePropertySet.PieYScale
member.summary: "Numeric Value 30-100" : This value sets the skewness of the pie chart (vertical slant).

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PiePropertySet.PieBorderAlpha
member.summary: "0-100" : This attribute helps you set the border transparency for all the pie borders.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PiePropertySet.PieBorderThickness
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : Each pie on the chart has a border, whose thickness you can specify using this attribute.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PiePropertySet.PieFillAlpha
member.summary: "0-100" : This attribute helps you set the transparency for all the pies on the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieVisibilityPropertySet.ShowPercentageValues
member.summary: If you've opted to show the data value, this attribute helps you control whether to show percentage values or actual values.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieVisibilityPropertySet.ShowPercentageInLabel
member.summary: If you've opted to show the data value, this attribute helps you control whether to show percentage values or actual values in the pie labels.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.PieVisibilityPropertySet.Animation
member.summary: This attribute sets whether the animation is to be played or whether the entire chart would be rendered at one go.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NameValueDisplayDistanceControlPropertySet.SlicingDistance
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : If you've opted to slice a particular pie, using this attribute you can control the distance between the sliced pie and the center of other pies.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.NameValueDisplayDistanceControlPropertySet.NameTBDistance
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute helps you set the distance of the name/value text boxes from the pie edge.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.GenericMSVisibilityPropertySet.ShowLegend
member.summary: This attribute sets whether the legend would be displayed at the bottom of the chart.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ZeroPlane2DPropertySet.ZeroPlaneThickness
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : Thickness (in pixels) of the line indicating the zero plane.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ZeroPlane2DPropertySet.ZeroPlaneColor
member.summary: "Hex Code" : The intended color for the zero plane.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.ZeroPlane2DPropertySet.ZeroPlaneAlpha
member.summary: "Numerical Value 0-100" : The intended transparency for the zero plane.

member.name: T:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet
member.summary: Anchors (or the marker points) are the polygons which appear at the joint of two consecutive lines. On a line chart, the anchors are the elements which react to the hover caption and link for that particular data point.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.ShowAnchors
member.summary: Configuration whether the anchors would be shown on the chart or not. If the anchors are not shown, then the hover caption and link functions won't work.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorSides
member.summary: "Numeric Value greater than 3": This attribute sets the number of sides the anchor will have. For e.g., an anchor with 3 sides would represent a triangle, with 4 it would be a square and so on.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorRadius
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchor. Greater the radius, bigger would be the anchor size.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorBorderColor
member.summary: "Hex Code" : Border Color of the anchor.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorBorderThickness
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : Thickness of the anchor border (in pixels).

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorBgColor
member.summary: "Hex Code" : Background color of the anchor.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorBgAlpha
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : Alpha of the anchor background.

member.name: P:Libero.FusionCharts.PropertySet.AnchorPropertySet.AnchorAlpha
member.summary: "Numeric Value" : This function lets you set the tranparency of the entire anchor (including the border). This attribute is particularly useful, when you do not want the anchors to be visible on the chart, but you want the hover caption and link functionality. In that case, you can set anchorAlpha to 0.
